title: BNP to present guidelines on 'poll-time supporting government'
text:
BNP to present guidelines on 'poll-time supporting government' Bhola and Khulna Correspondents, bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-19 04:22:50.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-19 04:22:50.0 BdST The BNP will soon present a guideline on a 'poll-time supporting government' that will facilitate for free, free and inclusive parliamentary elections. 
BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir told a programme of the party in Bhola on Saturday that the BNP “wants the election, but it will have to be participated by all.” 
"A poll-time supporting government, which will be able to conduct the Election Commission properly, is needed for that. That government will help the EC hold impartial polls," he said. 
Declaring that the party will soon come up with the guideline for this government, he expected a positive response from the ruling party. 
BNP Standing Committee Member Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury in a separate programme in Khulna also said his party had finalised the guideline and it will soon be presented as a proposal. 
In her proposal to form and strengthen the EC, BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia raised the demand for a 'poll-time supporting government'. 
The party sits out of Parliament after the boycott of the Jan 5, 2014, election as its demand for a caretaker government during the polls was not met. 
Khaleda, however, had refused Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's proposal for a poll-time government with all parties at that time, sticking to the ‘caretaker government’ demand. 
Now the party is not using the term ‘caretaker’and demanding a 'supporting poll-time government' instead, insisting that a fair election is not possible when a partisan government is in power. 
Awami League Presidium Member Mohammed Nasim on Friday said it depends on Hasina who she will keep in the poll-time government.
